text: hello my name is redcoat viking and in this video i'm going to be talking about a game called farmingsim22 because it recently won a vote on the channel you guys wanted me to review it so here we are now in all honesty a lot of my friends scoff at the thought of me playing farming sim and i can understand why because i probably would have too before i started playing the series back in 2013 but honestly it's one of the best sandbox experiences that money can buy and fs22 at least in my opinion is no exception but the main question is if you've played one of the other games before you're probably wondering if it's worth buying or if you should just stick to fs19 or even if you're new to the series you might be wondering if it's worth paying the extra cash to get the latest version of the game or if it's just almost the same as one of the previous and much cheaper games such as fs19 and that's what i'm going to be trying to cover in this video now fs22 and fs19 are really similar games
title: A Review of Farming Simulator 22
author: RedcoatViking

text: that's what i'm going to be trying to cover in this video now fs22 and fs19 are really similar games graphically almost identical with some improved field textures to fs22 but what i'd say fs22 does so much more is it adds loads of really small but really noticeable quality of life improvements that make the game feel so much more complete and realistic and authentic and that's something i think the game's been lacking for quite a while and fs22 kind of manages to bring up the realism aspect and it although it doesn't bring a whole lot more new content it does still manage to cram some decent stuff in there as well so for me one of the biggest and most noticeable changes in fs22 is the audio especially when driving inside the cabin of a vehicle and you can hear the creaking and the bouncing of the wheels as you drive along the road and you hear it change as you go over uneven surfaces and it really feels like you're in the vehicle and i really appreciate that there are still some
title: A Review of Farming Simulator 22
author: RedcoatViking

text: and it really feels like you're in the vehicle and i really appreciate that there are still some improvements to the overall audio so you'll hear the difference in third person too but you'll notice them the most when you're in first person in the cab and then they've also added tree felling sound effects which kind of sounds a bit ridiculous now that i say it you should always really have heard a tree falling over but because of the sandbox nature of the game and the physics nature of it all i imagine that actually took quite some work so being able to hear the tree falling over after you've cut it down really just adds an extra layer of of quality at least to me now like i said graphically the game is very very similar if not identical to fs19 and it does look a little bit shinier but it's not going to blow you away and the game does look good though but fs19 look good too but they have added some much better field textures for when you uh use the new rollers over grass for example
title: A Review of Farming Simulator 22
author: RedcoatViking

text: added some much better field textures for when you uh use the new rollers over grass for example you see the grass mush down you also get a fertilizer bonus for that which is fairly realistic and the biggest improvement to me is the ploughing texture the ploughing now when you plow a field it looks like you've actually created grooves in the land now there is still no terrain deformation so you're not actually making holes in the ground but as far as i know no farming sim has ever managed to pull that off so it must be incredibly hard to do but the textures they've added look really really good so it's kind of easy to forget that you're not actually deforming the terrain it just it looks good enough to believe that you are well overall i think i think the graphics have had a slight bit of polish and a very small improvement over fs19 but like i said the overall graphics quality of the game is pretty much the same on the vehicle maintenance side of things they have done a few changes
title: A Review of Farming Simulator 22
author: RedcoatViking

text: game is pretty much the same on the vehicle maintenance side of things they have done a few changes though which is very much appreciated so first of all um your vehicles can get a little bit rusty and as they age the performance also goes down they've also added manual gearboxes which you can toggle on and off but all vehicles now have manual gears even if you choose automatic so they'll still go up through one two three four and high and low and all that even if it's on automatic and that's both good and bad um that's always been a mod for previous farming sim games i've never really wanted it i don't see the point i get a bit tired of shifting gears even if it's just two keys on the keyboard or with a h shifter it's not really my thing it's cool for people that do want it but what to me the biggest impact that has is even if you choose automatic gears if you're in an underpowered tractor going up a hill pulling a plow that maybe you just have slightly too few hp to pull um it's
title: A Review of Farming Simulator 22
author: RedcoatViking

text: tractor going up a hill pulling a plow that maybe you just have slightly too few hp to pull um it's gonna start jumping through the gears constantly back and forth trying to find that right gear and it leads to a really jerky experience i didn't like that all that much i wish you could just remove the manual gears completely not just have automatic but just remove the gearbox completely and drive it like it was in previous farming some games however if you're not an idiot like me and you actually get a tractor that is strong enough to pull the machinery over hill well you probably won't notice any of the problems and all of everything i've said here will be in vain something you might like though is that they've added seasons the old seasons mod from previous games so now you can toggle that on and off as well and that's pretty much the same for everything i'm going to be mentioning mentioning in this video you can toggle it all on and off but they've added seasons so crops now by
title: A Review of Farming Simulator 22
author: RedcoatViking

text: mentioning in this video you can toggle it all on and off but they've added seasons so crops now by default will grow at certain times of the year they can only be planted at certain times of the year and in the winter you're going to have snow which can be shoveled just like in previous games the same way that hay and all other grass and everything you can pile up can be shoveled using a wheel loader and bucket and dumped wherever you like it and it'll melt automatically when it starts getting warm again maps included in the game are pretty nice definitely much more detail in the vanilla maps for the first time in many many years there's one us map one european map and then there's ellen grant which was a dlc i think it's somewhere in the swiss or austrian mountains uh in fs19 which was one of my favorite maps so i'm glad it's there now too so you get three maps included in the base game and plus if that's not enough there's just endless mods with endless maps that you can just try
title: A Review of Farming Simulator 22
author: RedcoatViking

text: game and plus if that's not enough there's just endless mods with endless maps that you can just try out for free just like previous games it's got multiplayer for up to 16 players at least on pc six on console another big thing for me is that you can now set a destination for an ai driver kind of like course play if you've ever used one of the previous mods in the previous games and i don't want to keep on just referencing previous games but we're so far into this series now i'm kind of thinking you might have already played it if you're watching this but it hopefully still makes sense if you don't know anything about farming sim either way now you can tell an ai where you want them to go and you can set that destination anywhere on the map it's really easy to do you pay them wages just as if they're working in the field and it seems to work really well and it saves you having to go back and forward to the shop if you don't feel like it so you can just send your ai over there hook him
title: A Review of Farming Simulator 22
author: RedcoatViking

text: and forward to the shop if you don't feel like it so you can just send your ai over there hook him up to whatever machinery you want him to bring back and then just send him back it's a much a much nicer experience if you don't feel like doing all the driving back and forth and of course they've added some new content like the ability to have a little vineyard you can now grow grapes and olives and you get the same 400 plus vehicles with over 100 brands including fent class john deere and landini the vehicles are actually really well done but i've never really had a problem with the vanilla vehicles in farming sims so that is to be expected at this point one thing they seem to have spent a lot of time on a little bit surprisingly is the character customizer and i'd say it's worthy almost of an mmo um you have a lot of clothes to choose from and you can customize your character both before you join the game every single time and from like a little wardrobe once you're in the game so you
title: A Review of Farming Simulator 22
author: RedcoatViking

text: you join the game every single time and from like a little wardrobe once you're in the game so you can change clothes i don't really know who that's for i don't know if it was worth the effort but you can make your character look pretty cool so that can't really be a bad thing and it's something fun if you're if you're into that kind of thing i guess another thing that i really appreciate is that the shop is much improved it's a much more virtual hands-on experience where you get to see the object or the vehicle you're going to buy you get to rotate the camera and have a look at it and it'll also tell you the best combinations or the recommended combinations for hooking that piece of machinery up to something else and you can buy that next piece of equipment from the combinations panel which is really nice because sometimes even though i've played the game for so many years and thousands of hours i would still be wondering well if i'm gonna buy this newfangled machine what can i hook
title: A Review of Farming Simulator 22
author: RedcoatViking

text: of hours i would still be wondering well if i'm gonna buy this newfangled machine what can i hook that up to and then you have to google a bunch of stuff and it's just a bit of a pain whereas now the combinations just kind of help you and show you automatically what it thinks you should hook that up to which is really nice the driving feel and the general handling of the driving has also been given some much-needed polish but we are still talking about farming sim here so it is still a little bit twitchy at high speeds and it's still entirely possible to launch a quad bike from one side of the map to the other and then probably get it stuck in the invisible wall surrounding a fence on the other side so like i said there are improvements but this is still farming simulator it's still the same kind of stiff engine and certain things especially when driving high speed and a tractor do in my opinion still need some more work there's a couple of other things i'm not too keen on either
title: A Review of Farming Simulator 22
author: RedcoatViking

text: in my opinion still need some more work there's a couple of other things i'm not too keen on either they've added stone removal to the game um which is i suppose a good thing if you if you want to drive backwards and forwards over the fields even more but really whenever you plow a field it digs up so many stones and you have to have a really pricey piece of machinery to remove the stones and in reality although you know it's trying to add and simulate more realism by making you remove stones it is ultimately just making you drive backwards and forwards on the same field just more times um when you already if you consider you already have to fertilize do weed removal you have to cultivate you have to plow you have to spray lime um there's a whole bunch of stuff you need to do so just adding something else to make you drive backwards and forwards on that field even more to me is a little bit unappreciated but the good thing is you can turn that off in the options just like seasons and
title: A Review of Farming Simulator 22
author: RedcoatViking

text: bit unappreciated but the good thing is you can turn that off in the options just like seasons and just like most other little things like having to plow as well you can turn that on and off depending on how realistic you want to get i would also like to see a few more classical vehicles added into the game i remember back in 2013 you started with a whole bunch of classical stuff i can't remember the names of most of them but there was an old blue tractor with no roof there was um you started with an mfr m66 combine harvester which looks really ugly but to me that is farming sim you kind of start at the bottom and work your way up now you tend to get more modern equipment you start ellen grant for example um with a electrified tractor and a bunch of other stuff pretty pricey and modern machinery and i would just like the ability to start with uh kind of the mindset that you've taken over this farm from your grandpa you need to then use this old equipment sell it or just sell your crops
title: A Review of Farming Simulator 22
author: RedcoatViking

text: this farm from your grandpa you need to then use this old equipment sell it or just sell your crops and build your way up i just prefer that kind of that kind of approach really but it is what it is um overall though i would say if you're on the fence about getting fs22 and you've played one of the previous games before it is definitely worth making the jump from previous games the only exception to that is if you really like fs19 and you're not too bothered about having things like having to remove stone from the fields having seasons because that is to be fair a mod that you can download for free in fs19 anyway you're not bothered about the character customization and overall it is still worth it because the grapes and the olives are there the textures are better there's a destination center for the ai but is it worth the extra money for me it was personally because i like those small things and i like the best graphics that you can get but if you're not too bothered about that stuff
title: A Review of Farming Simulator 22
author: RedcoatViking

text: things and i like the best graphics that you can get but if you're not too bothered about that stuff then you're not really missing out by just sticking with fs19 and maybe waiting for fs24 or whatever comes later and seeing if there's any bigger jump forward there there aren't any major mechanics added to the game that really make it worth that jump if you're not bothered about the small changes they've added if you're brand new to the series though i would definitely recommend starting with fs22 because you get just the most complete experience there's no reason unless price is your biggest concern there's no reason to get fs19 over fs22 if you're coming into the series now or if you haven't upgraded your game since like fs17 or fs15 so unless money is a big factor because fs19 is a lot cheaper then definitely go for fs22 if you need to save a bit of cash then fs19 if you're brand new would be the best place to start and you'll still get a perfectly perfectly good experience the
title: A Review of Farming Simulator 22
author: RedcoatViking

text: new would be the best place to start and you'll still get a perfectly perfectly good experience the proper modern farming sim experience in fs19 if you can't afford fs22 be sure to check g2a though if you're not afraid of grey market sites because you can get all those games much cheaper on there and they usually sell steam keys for them as well but that was my take on farming sim 22 overall i love the game i am starting to fall a little bit out of love with work simulators now i have to be honest because i've worked for so many years in real life i don't really want to work when i come back too so for me i've generally stopped playing them as much i used to pump hundreds of hours into games like farming sim whereas now it might be 10 20 hours a month maximum if i'm kind of feeling farmy and i want to i want to you know really yeah get involved i just can't sit there and and and work for free i'd rather be outside working and doing a real job for real money and that's just because i'm
title: A Review of Farming Simulator 22
author: RedcoatViking

text: free i'd rather be outside working and doing a real job for real money and that's just because i'm getting old though um i think though the game is really good it's coming a long way and overall i do definitely recommend it and in a way i'm kind of sad that i don't have that love for the the genre anymore but it is what it is when you become an old man like me but thank you so much for watching um as you can tell i'm trying a different style with reviews now i can't really muster up the energy to write a whole script and try and bash it all out in three to five minutes i'm just not feeling it for that anymore and also the views and everything like that they just weren't really making it worthwhile either so i hope this isn't too bad but do let me know in the comments what you thought and if you have any other games you'd like me to review by all means slap them in the comments and i'll do my best i have promised that the next video is going to be a review of assetto corsa competizione
title: A Review of Farming Simulator 22
author: RedcoatViking

text: do my best i have promised that the next video is going to be a review of assetto corsa competizione for one of my friends who voted on that but it unfortunately didn't win so if you voted on that too hopefully that'll put a smile on your face but until the next time guys if you haven't already go ahead and subscribe if you like this video and i'll see you in the next video thank you so much for watching take care [Music]
title: A Review of Farming Simulator 22
